intro: Schoenoplectus mucronatus var. sanguineus, commonly known as the red-tipped bulrush, is a variant of the bulrush genus native to wetland environments. It is characterized by its reddish-brown stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in shallow water or moist soil, often in marshes and along the edges of ponds. Its flowering spikes, which appear in late summer, are usually pink to red in color, adding visual interest to its habitat. This variant is valued for its ecological role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for aquatic life.
